triples.name: Agent-based model
triples.relevance: The paper reviews validation methods specifically for agent-based models and simulations.

triples.name: Verification and validation
triples.relevance: Validation is the core process reviewed in the paper for determining if models adequately represent systems.

triples.name: Computer simulation
triples.relevance: Agent-based models are implemented as computer simulations, which are the subject of validation in this paper.

triples.name: Empirical research
triples.relevance: Empirical validation is one of the nine key validation methods reviewed in the paper.

triples.name: Sampling (statistics)
triples.relevance: Sampling is reviewed as a foundational validation-supporting method for agent-based simulations.

triples.name: Data and information visualization
triples.relevance: Visualization is reviewed as a foundational method for validating and understanding agent-based models.

triples.name: Bootstrapping (statistics)
triples.relevance: Bootstrapping is reviewed as an advanced validation-supporting method for agent-based simulations.

triples.name: Causal analysis
triples.relevance: Causal analysis is reviewed as an advanced validation method to understand mechanisms in agent-based models.

triples.name: Computational social science
triples.relevance: Inverse generative social science, a validation method reviewed in the paper, relates to computational approaches in social science.

triples.name: Role-playing
triples.relevance: Role-playing is reviewed as an advanced validation method that can support credibility assessment of agent-based simulations.
